name: Spring
notes: A tightly wound coil of metal, useful for crafting mechanisms.

name: Spring Cushion
notes: Can be recycled into crafting materials.

name: Stable Stock I
notes: Slightly improves dispersion & recoil recovery time.

name: Stable Stock II
notes: Moderately improves dispersion & recoil recovery time.

name: Stable Stock III
notes: Significantly improves dispersion & recoil recovery time.

name: Statuette
notes: Worth a small fortune.

name: Steel Spring
notes: Used to craft a wide range of items. Can be recycled into crafting materials. Used to craft: Extended Shotgun Mag I, Extended Medium Mag I, Extended Light Mag I, Torrente, Extended Medium Mag II

name: Sterilized Bandage
notes: A medical item that gradually restores a large amount of health over time.

name: Stitcher I
notes: Deals good damage, but has quite a low fire-rate and can be hard to control.

name: Stitcher II
notes: Deals good damage, but has quite a low fire-rate and can be hard to control.

name: Stitcher III
notes: Full automatic SMG. Deals good damage, but has quite a low fire-rate and can be hard to control.

name: Stitcher IV
notes: Full automatic SMG. Deals good damage, but has quite a low fire-rate and can be hard to control.

name: Surge Shield Recharger
notes: A handheld kit that recharges a shield on use.

name: Surveyor Vault
notes: Can be recycled into crafting materials.

name: Synthesized Fuel
notes: A canister of synthetic fuel blend.

name: Syringe
notes: Used to craft medical supplies. Can be recycled into plastic. Used to craft: Vita Shot

name: Tactical Mk. 1
notes: Basic tactical augment. More Quick Use slots for more tactical choice, but limited survivability and slightly lower looting potential.

name: Tactical Mk. 2
notes: Adds more backpack space and an extra utility item slot.

name: Tactical Mk. 3 (Healing)
notes: A healing-focused augment which adds extra slots for healing items. When revived from being downed, releases a healing cloud that restores 20 health over 10 seconds. Has a 30-second cooldown.

name: Tagging Grenade
notes: A grenade that detonates after a delay, tagging Raiders and ARC enemies in an area, allowing you to briefly track their location.

name: Tattered Arc Lining
notes: Can be recycled into crafting materials.

name: Thermostat
notes: Can be recycled into crafting materials.

name: Tick Pod
notes: Can be recycled into crafting materials.

name: Toaster
notes: Can be recycled into crafting materials.

name: Torn Blanket
notes: Can be recycled into fabric.

name: Torn Book
notes: What pages remain speak of heroes, vampires, and lots of glances.

name: Torrente Blueprint
notes: Has a large ammo capacity, but is only accurate while crouched.

name: Torrente I
notes: Has a large ammo capacity, but is only accurate while crouched

name: Torrente II
notes: Has a large ammo capacity, but is only accurate while crouched.

name: Torrente III
notes: Has a large ammo capacity, but is only accurate while crouched.

name: Torrente IV
notes: Has a large ammo capacity, but is only accurate while crouched.

name: Trigger 'Nade
notes: A remote-detonated grenade that can stick to surfaces and ARC, dealing explosive damage when triggered.

name: Trigger Nade Blueprint
notes: A remote-detonated grenade that can stick to surfaces and ARC, dealing explosive damage when triggered.

name: Turbo Pump
notes: Can be recycled into crafting materials.

name: Vase
notes: Worth a small fortune.

name: Venator Blueprint
notes: Fires two shots at a time.

name: Venator I
notes: Semi-automatic pistol. Fires two shots at a time.

name: Venator II
notes: Semi-automatic pistol. Fires two shots at a time.

name: Vertical Grip I
notes: Slightly reduces vertical recoil. Compatible with: Tempest, Arpeggio, Kettle, Ferro, Hullcracker

name: Vertical Grip II
notes: Moderately reduces vertical recoil. Compatible with: Arpeggio, Ferro, Venator, Il Toro, Stitcher

name: Very Comfortable Pillow
notes: The envy of every Raider. Like sleeping on an especially ergonomic cloud.

name: Vita Shot
notes: A medical item that restores a large amount of health.

name: Vita Spray
notes: A medical item that continuously restores health during use. Can be used on yourself or your allies.

name: Vita Spray Blueprint
notes: A medical item that continuously restores health during use. Can be used on yourself or your allies.

name: Volcanic Rock
notes: Can be thrown.

name: Voltage Converter
notes: Used in crafting. Used to craft: Heavy Shield, Showstopper

name: Vulcano I
notes: Semi-automatic shotgun with good bullet spread but sharp falloff.

name: Vulcano II
notes: Has good bullet spread but sharp falloff.

name: Vulcano III
notes: Has good bullet spread but sharp falloff.

name: Wasp Driver
notes: Can be recycled into ARC Alloy. Can be thrown, and will explode if shot.

name: Watch
notes: A wristwatch that has stopped ticking.

name: Water Filter
notes: A portable filtration device for purifying water.

name: Water Pump
notes: Can be recycled into crafting materials.

name: Wires
notes: Used to craft a wide range of items. Can be recycled into crafting materials. Used to craft: Blaze Grenade Trap, Smoke Grenade Trap, Lure Grenade Trap, Gas Grenade Trap, Muzzle Brake I

name: Wolfpack
notes: A grenade that scatters into multiple homing missiles, each one targeting ARC and dealing explosive damage on impact.

name: Wolfpack Blueprint
notes: A remote-detonated grenade that can stick to surfaces and ARC, dealing explosive damage when triggered.

name: Yellow Light Stick
notes: A throwable chemical light that illuminates the area around it.

name: Zipline
notes: A deployable zipline that allows you to quickly move between two locations.
